thread.title: At the SAG Awards, Winona Ryder’s Facial Expressions Are the GIFs That Keep On Giving
thread.title_full: At the SAG Awards, Winona Ryder’s Facial Expressions Are the GIFs That Keep On Giving

title: At the SAG Awards, Winona Ryder’s Facial Expressions Are the GIFs That Keep On Giving
text:
At the SAG Awards, Winona Ryder’s Facial Expressions Are the GIFs That Keep On Giving Expand Photo: Courtesy of TNT 
Winona Ryder, beloved ’90s pinup girl, once again stepped into the spotlight last night when the cast of Stranger Things climbed onto the stage at the Shrine Auditorium to accept their award as Outstanding Ensemble in a Drama. As castmate David Harbour delivered a powerful speech saluting the actor’s role to use “art to battle against fear, self-centeredness, and exclusivity of our predominately narcissistic culture and . . . to cultivate a more empathetic and understanding society” in the face of the “hypocrisy and casual violence” of the current administration, Ryder managed to experience several swells of emotion, seemingly all at once. Social media, of course, didn’t miss a beat. Some of the best reactions, here: 
— Deadline Hollywood (@Deadline) January 30, 2017 
— ashwini balaganesh (@ashbalaganesh) January 30, 2017 
— Entertainment Weekly (@EW) January 30, 2017 
— Jen Lewis (@thisjenlewis) January 30, 2017 
— Jarett Wieselman (@JarettSays) January 30, 2017 
Wino Forever spent that ENTIRE #StrangerThings speech giving the Internet TROVES of GIF material. Thank you, Winona. #sagawards -H — Heather & Jessica (@fuggirls) January 30, 2017
